title.narrative: JESE improving self reliance 4 DRC refug

description.narrative:
JESE -Joint Efforts to Save the Environment, is an indigenous Non-Governmental Organisation (NGO) established in 1993, by professionals of diverse backgrounds. JESE has the desire of increasing household food security, through sustainable agriculture forimproved agricultural production and marketing and incomes amongst the rural communities. Collaborative natural resource management for improved biodiversity conservation and ecosystems management and integrated water resources management, for improved access to water, sanitation and hygiene services in a participatory manner and gender inclusiveness. Over the years the institution has involved in regards to gender integration in her programs through a participatory process that has enabled the institution develop a gender policy, and a strategic process that enables the institution to analyse, plan, empower beneficiaries to participate equally in the process of addressing key and relevant gender issues in program execution and monitoring. In addition, JESE focuses keenly and regards a moreparamount process at recruitment level, strategic plan, development and review process, project design, planning and day to day activity implementation taking into consideration the positive gender aspect that harnesses integration and joint decision undertaking on the importance of increasing women and other marginalised groups# participation and involvement in planning and implementation and to influence the existing structures to appreciate the sharing roles and responsibilities in an inclusive manner in the vent of realising program outputs. The main objectives of JESE include: SO1: Increased income and food security among 1400 targeted households(7000 individuals). SO2: Improved natural resource management intargeted catchments. SO3: Equitable access and use of safe water, sanitation and hygiene services in communities and institutions In this project initiative, JESE' will support the delivery of the following outcomes: 1. Increase in toilet cover per village of persons with special needs 2. Targeted beneficiaries of persons daily engaged in cash for work activities have met their food and non-food needs (youth and women) 3. An increase in the population of trees available on plots of persons of specialneeds and host community
Key Project Out puts include: 1.1 Increased number of toilets used/ functional among People of Special Needs 1.2 Increased number of woodlots established to conserve the environment 1.3 Increasednumber of fruit trees planted per household 1.4 Increased care and management of fruit trees planted by PSNs 1.5 Increase in amountof daily income of a household through cash for work JESE will work in Kyaka refugee settlement supported by Oxfam EFSVL , Gender and protection andWASH technical teams
